page.title: 11Village Life in General cont
page.content: Farming predominates and the luscious green fields with its hedgerow provide ample acres of grassland for the cattle and sheep to roam the hillsides. Those members of the village not involved in farming travel out to the industry of Cheadle or the Potteries. A small bone meal factory and bulk seed producer/distributor are the only independant work units in the area. The old Foxfield Mine is at present being regenerated (for a few months at least) while the coal that remains is excuvated and its spoil tips levelled. Walking along the lanes you could well imagine life of earlier days. Mrs Dale recalls how old Mr. Dale delivered the post on foot and how he was only allowed an allowance of ten pounds per week for the Post Office. In 1914 O.A.P. was 5 shillings.
